AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS only collected initial context and suggested uploading files; there is no customer-facing evidence that the AI provided incorrect/misleading guidance or a broken/garbled template that impacted resolution.
evidence: ATLAS (private transcript): "If you have any 📃 log files or 🖼️ screenshots to upload to help with the troubleshooting, now is the time to do it"
Customer (public): "Thanks for the key. Requested logs and diagnostic files attached to the case."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: After ticket creation, humans engaged and responded publicly; there is no evidence the customer was stuck in an AI-only loop after requesting a human.
evidence: Randall Shawver (public): "To properly resolve this recurring issue, I need you to run the following commands and provide the output"
Syed Haider (public): "Please join me for your scheduled meeting using this link"

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support acknowledged the prior ticket and used details from previous diagnostics; there is no customer-facing evidence that the customer was forced to repeat already-provided information after stating it was already shared.
evidence: Randall Shawver (public): "#60192334 ... From the diagnostic output you provided in ticket #60192334, I've identified some specific concerns"
Customer (public): "Thanks for the key. Requested logs and diagnostic files attached to the case."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: There were customer follow-ups asking for updates/ASAP responses and support later apologized for delayed response, indicating meaningful response delays. The overall resolution time was also very long per CSV, aligning with the customer’s repeated chasers.
evidence: Customer (public, 2025-10-26): "Please any update here? Can you provide the below request ASAP."
Customer (public, 2025-11-02): "Please can you get back to us ASAP on the requested Webex call?"
Syed Haider (public, 2025-11-04): "I sincerely apologize for the delayed response on this ticket."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: Although the ticket contains auto-closure warning language and the CSV shows the ticket was closed, there is no customer-facing evidence after the solution steps/call indicating an unresolved request at the time of closure.
evidence: Randall Shawver (public): "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with 'This ticket can be closed' or update the status to Completed in the portal."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The customer expressed urgency, but there is no explicit P1/SEV1/outage language; support engaged with technical remediation steps and scheduled a live session rather than treating it purely as routine generic troubleshooting.
evidence: Customer (public): "We are at critical stage and must expediate all the tasks and activities"
Syed Haider (public): "Cleared excess snapshots and logs to free up disk space... Updated log rotation settings..."
